Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SpStrongylocin 1 (S. purpuratus Strongylocin, UCSS1a; 3S=S, natural AMPs; sea urchin, Echinoidea, marine animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Homologous to Strongylocin 1.Sequence analysis: 95.83% similar to Strongylocin 1.Activity: Active against Gram- L. anguillarum serotype O2 (MIC 15 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 7.5 uM), Gram+ C. glutamicum ATCC 13032 (MIC 7.5 uM), and S. aureus ATCC 9144 (MIC 15 uM). The minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) was set at the lowest concentration of peptide reducing the OD to less than 50% of the growth control.MOA:bacteria: probably act on intracellular targets.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: Recombinant peptides are active against bacteria.Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Li C, Blencke HM, Smith LC, Karp MT, Stensv√•g K.2010
Literature Information.Title: Two recombinant peptides, SpStrongylocins 1 and 2, from Strongylocentrotus purpuratus, show antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria
